name: 2010 Movie Taglines Quiz | Movie Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Bad.  Blue.  Brilliant."

What movie is this tagline for?
questions.explanation:
Megamind.

	"Megamind" was released on November 5, 2010.  It is about a blue villain with a large, bald head who ends up destroying the superhero of the town, and must become the new superhero in order to save it.  Other taglines are below..."What if the bad guy won?""Heroes aren't born.  They're made.""What if these guys had to save the world?"

questions.text:
"The end begins."  "Nowhere is safe."

These are taglines for a highly anticipated 2010 movie.  Which one?
questions.correct: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
options: Star Wars VII: Evil Strikes Again
Indiana Jones V: Eternal Cross of Paradise
questions.explanation:
Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1.

	Part One of the final title in the "Harry Potter" series was released on November 19, 2010.  In this movie, Voldemort is stronger, and now has control over the Ministry of Magic.  It's up to Harry, Hermione, and Ron to stop him.  Other taglines are below..."It all ends here.""Part 1 of the Epic Finale.""The hunt begins."

questions.text:
"They're taking adventure to new lengths."

A new take on an old classic uses this tagline.  What is it called?
questions.explanation:
Tangled.

	"Tangled" was released on November 24, 2010.  The movie is based on the original "Rapunzel".  In "Tangled", she is a teenager with hair that is 70 feet long, who was trapped in the tower because her hair was magic.  She must now venture out of the tower for the first time in her entire life.

questions.text:
"What doesn't kill you... is going to marry your brother."

What 2010 movie is this the tagline for?
questions.explanation:
You Again.

	"You Again" was released on September 24, 2010.  It is about a young woman who discovers that her brother is about to marry someone who bullied her in high school.  Now she wants to prove that he is about to marry someone who is hiding who they really are.

questions.text:
"A challenge he never imagined.  A teacher he never expected."

This movie about kung fu was ironically named what?
questions.explanation:
The Karate Kid.

	"The Karate Kid" was released on June 11, 2010.  This remake of a classic starts Jaden Smith (Will Smith's son) and Jackie Chan.  Jackie Chan originally wanted the movie to be known as "The Kung Fu Kid", because the movie actually centers around Kung Fu, and NOT Karate.  The movie is often also called "The New Karate Kid".

questions.text:
"Be the first to meet fourteen new characters."

Yes, a lot of new characters were introduced in this animated movie, including Ken and Mr. Pricklepants.  What movie is this?
questions.explanation:
Toy Story 3.

	"Toy Story 3" was released on June 18, 2010.  In this movie, Andy is moving to college, and packs all his old toys into a box, which was meant to go to the attic.  However, they accidentally go to a day care center by mistake, where they meet a lot of new characters.  The movie is about the toys' attempt to escape Sunnyside (the day care center) and get back to Andy's place.

questions.text:
"Superbad.  Superdad."

What movie is this a tagline for?
options: Did You Hear About the Morgans?
questions.explanation:
Despicable Me.

	"Despicable Me" was released on July 9, 2010.  It is about an evil man named Gru, who adopts three little girls to use as part of his master scheme to steal the moon.  However, he ends up realizing he loves these girls and eventually becomes a "good guy".

questions.text:
"Back then they were too young to know better.  Now they have no excuse."

Five funnymen come together to make which of these movies that uses the above tagline?
questions.explanation:
Grown Ups.

	"Grown Ups" was released on June 25, 2010.  Five friends and former basketball teammates come together to celebrate the Fourth of July weekend after their old coach passes away.  The five funnymen in this movie are David Spade, Rob Schneider, Chris Rock, Adam Sandler, and Kevin James.

questions.text:
"A story about family, first loves, second chances and the moments of life that lead you back home."

Quite a lengthy tagline, but it basically provides a summary for which 2010 movie?
questions.explanation:
The Last Song.

	"The Last Song" was released on March 31, 2010.  Miley Cyrus plays Ronnie, a teenage girl who visits her father for the summer, after he and his wife (Ronnie's mother) had a divorce.  Ronnie originally does not want to be with her father, but she discovers it is actually okay, as she finds the love of her life, and reconnects with her father.

questions.text:
"A pawsome 3D adventure."  "Grrl power."  "He'll quack you up."

Which animal-based movie has these taglines?
options: Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole
Cats and Dogs: Revenge of Kitty Galore
questions.explanation:
Alpha and Omega.

	"Alpha and Omega" was released on September 17, 2010.  It is about two wolves who are captured and relocated so they can repopulate.  Kate (the female wolf, alpha) does not like this idea too much, and they try to return home.
